item.title: Bash cheetsheet
item.author: blazeva1 -a- fit.cvut.cz <Václav Blažej> (Václav Blažej)
item.description: What to use Use may want to use shellcheck program to check beginner mistakes. The script should start with a shebang line #!/usr/bin/env bash To make the script runnable use chmod u+x ./script.sh system_name=$(uname) script_path=$(realpath $0) if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then echo "usage: ..."; fi #compare numbers using -eq -ne -lt -le -gt -ge #compare strings using = != < <= > >= while [ $# -ne 0 ]; do shift; done #remove the first argument with shift array=( 'a' 'b' 'c d' ) echo "Array of ${#array[@]} contains: ${array[*]}" for element in "${array[@]}"; do echo "Value: $element" if [ "$element" = "c d" ]; then break; elif [ "$element" = "a" ]; then continue; echo "Only the element 'b' is printed here" done unset array if [ -f "file.
